metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4913 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The get_rock_ridge_filename function in fs/isofs/rock.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5.5 mishandles NM (aka alternate name) entries containing \0 characters, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted isofs filesystem. It was discovered that an information leak exists in the Rock Ridge implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker who is able to mount a malicious iso9660 file system image could exploit this flaw to obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4913` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-28-generic - 4.4.0-28.47
linux-image-4.4.0-28-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-28.47
linux-image-4.4.0-28-lowlatency - 4.4.0-28.47
linux-image-4.4.0-28-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-28.47
linux-image-4.4.0-28-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-28.47
linux-image-4.4.0-28-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-28.47
linux-image-4.4.0-28-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-28.47
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-28-generic - 4.4.0-28.47
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10

No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> introduced in 0.98pl6+

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-28.47').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1016.22').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-28.47').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1019.22').
